reviews.review_msg: Spring 2023: Would not seek him out as a prof but he was ok. Slides had a ridiculous amount of information on them and He does not say a single word on the slides during the lecture. exams can have very specific questions as well. His exams were decent but there was a time crunch and tutorials were optional. He ain't that bad just very monotone.

Dr. Paetzel did a pretty good job. The exams were fairly easy, but there was a ton of material to memorize. The lectures were pretty dry at times, but the content was actually interesting. Dr. Paetzel was always available after class to answer any questions students might have.
As I prepare for this second midterm I am realizing this degree ain't for me.

Professor Paetzel is a good prof and fairly accessible since he is always available for questions after the lecture. You can tell that he is very passionate about proteins but the lectures are sometimes dry. Make sure to understand and memorize the slides and you will be set! Also tutorials really help you understand the material.

Dr. Paetzel was never accessible outside of lecs and the TAs weren't too helpful in answering questions. Not enough practice and very heavy lectures, so most of the course had to be self-taught. Exam questions were asked vaguely but required an answer identical to the answer key. Almost an impossible A regardless of how much content you know.

Dr. Paetzel wasn't bad but also not great by any means. His lectures are very monotone and definitely not for everyone, though I didnt mind them. His test questions come directly off his slides - and are either 1) incredibly easy or 2) wildly difficult and specific. Overall, I'd take a course with him again but I wouldn't seek him out as a prof.

Lecture slides are more helpful than his actual live lectures, assignments are literally just regurgitating lecture slides, exams only cover a fraction of the material so you'll waste time studying things that wont even be tested and mark will not respond to any questions. The class isn't too hard but you'll be teaching yourself

dr. paetzel is a very intelligent person however lectures based on anything besides his specialty of proteins can be hard to watch. He has very detailed lecture slides but will go through the whole lecture without reading any of the words on them. If you study outside of class time doing textbook readings and studying the lec notes you will be fine

As others mentioned , he is ghost. Very dry and boring lectures & slides. He didn't reply to single emails. Assignments are all summarizing lectures. You have to watch his lectures and write summarization. and they grade assignment based on grammer like Engl class. No practice Qs , No preparation for midterms. Also TAs are useless. AVOID at any cos

Don't expect Dr. Paetzel to respond to your emails. He is a ghost outside of class time. He has very good slides, but the lectures are useless cause he just reads them. The exams are also not marked fairly; if you don't write the answer key exactly, you'll be marked off. Avoid him if you can!

Tutorials have no structure and the course overall is super exam heavy. It would be expected that the prof would provide some form of preparation such as extra assignments. Overall, the lectures are very thorough and interesting.

Avoid this course with Dr. Paetzel. He is not accessible, does not reply to emails, lectures are very disorganized and dry. Most assignments are very short and ask for Summarizing his lectures rather than providing practice for exams. Moreover, assignments are due the day of the exam. Would recommend waiting for another professor.

A lot of people don't really understand Dr. Paetzel, but he really cares about his students and their well-being. He wants to make sure that everyone understands what is being taught, and does a very good job of explaining the material. There are weekly assignments for completion marks, and exams are on par with assignments in terms of difficulty.
Rarely answered questions students had, and basically required you to memorize his information-heavy lectures slides in order to get a decent grade (not a great way to learn the material).

Mark is one of the nicest profs!! He was extremely understanding and takes mental health very seriously. His exams are all based off his lecture slides, so I recommend memorizing all the slides and understanding those concepts. I barely used the textbook at all. Also, I would say that the difficulty of the exams is moderate.

Mark is the sweetest professor ever! He doesn't reply to emails, but he has open discussion boards where you can ask questions, tries to answer questions during class time and hosts office hours once a week. Test material is fair and forces you to apply concepts to demonstrate your understanding. *I took this course remotely due to the pandemic*

I don't know why some reviews say that he is approachable. Well, let me tell you he's not. Doesn't answer emails about course-related content. Normally has office hours right after class, which is no good because students have other classes too. Canvas quizzes are worded poorly, good for reading practice, the meaning of the quiz is unmined.

He is a terrible prof. Not only that, he isn't very understanding of his students, kind of indifferent to them like they are part of an experiment he doesn't really care about? I honestly think profs like him shouldn't be allowed to teach, as having basic social skills should be a requirement to be a professor.

He is seriously the WORST PROF EVER! He can't even keep the class' attention for more than 1 minute. After the first minute, half the class is already gone, and the other half has fallen asleep. He is completely out of touch with his students and it's clear he doesn't get out of his lab much, and maybe he should just stay there to save all of us?

Although his lectures may seem boring but he has a depth knowledge of what he teaches. His exams are straight forward from the lecture notes. Make sure you study the diagrams in the notes in and out. He likes proteins so much. Tutorial are very helpful. He got a great team of TAs. Overall, he is a good prof.

Can't blame the guy for having boring lectures. I mean there really is no other way to talk in an interesting way about the stuff we go through. Hes a nice guy and puts in a bit of dry humor. Exams were rather hard and went into great detail. Textbook was really helpful in this class.

His first time teaching 222, didnt know how to make the first exam, but got better after. His lec are extremely boring, have to read the slide before talking most of the time. Be sure to study the notes well and the previous mts. His questions are straight of the notes, and he will a few questions that go into more depth. He loves his bonds.

His exam questions are usually from the lecture notes and the tutorial questions. That being said, this is not an easy class because there is A LOT of memorization! However, his notes are really good so you don't need the textbook. He is always open to helping people with any questions. Nice guy, he's sort of like a cute grandpa.

His ability to lecture is not so great (boring) however he is a very nice professor - seems to be willing to help students succeed. His tests are based on his PowerPoint slides, as well as tutorial assignments, so really pay attention to those! Midterm and final was fair, not too hard, but not too easy. Having a good memory would definitely help.

Overly detailed lecture slides and ridiculously dry lectures. If you are an auditory learner avoid taking the class with him. That being said his tests were very fair, and he posted great review packages. One of those classes where you need to learn everything outside of lecture.
Really nice prof! He really cares about his students and puts a lot thought into his lectures. His exams are also straightforward and easy to do well on if you study his lecture notes.

Great course, great professor, although his lectures are a bit on the dry side. If you fall asleep easy, you may want to stick to another professor. But on the bright side, he records his lectures so that helps A LOT! Warning: TA's will be your biggest obstacle. Tutorial questions very difficult. Good practice for exams though. Like!

Great prof! Lectures are fairly dry, but he is VERY informative. All lecture recordings are online, which I found to be EXTREMELY helpful. He is very willing answer questions and clarify difficult topics for you. Midterm/final are straight from the notes! His review slides cover the main focuses on his exams. Dont worry if u find tutorial sets hard
Really nice prof.Study off lecture notes, and make sure not to get lazy by the end of the course. Final exam is a must study for.

Do not buy the textbook for the course if you have him! All you need to study for his midterms/final is his lecture notes and the practice problems. Read/complete those and you'll do fine in this course! He's a super nice professor, and easily approachable. The lectures are super boring, but overall worth going to. Tutorials however were useless.

This prof is great if you like to read just the slides and don't like to read the text. However, he spends just a little more time looking at his notes than the students and interacting with them. Also, he goes thru examples so make sure you pay great attention then!!but in general very nice and approachable!
His notes/slides are good. Just memorize his notes and you'll do very well in this class! :) He's a little monotone but he's very knowledgeable and approachable. His exams are VERY fair!

Professor was really fair, can't blame him for my performance. Lecture notes were great, maybe not the most interesting prof but without attending lecture, if you strictly study his notes, you could ace this course. Wish i had a second shot at it

People were saying that he is hard for Mbb222, after I taking it!he is boring in class, and he look Scientist ?? but, he grades marks so fair and exam is pretty much from lecture note, and he told you what is coving in exam and what is not. so is

This guy is the best prof - very fair and concise.  He is intelligent, knowledgeable, considerate, etc. and actually cares about the course. Anyone who thinks otherwise is either a complete dumb ass or doesn't know what they're talking about.

BORING! This guy cannot explain ANYTHING clearly. His notes are hard to read and lack logic and clarity.  When you come to his office hours with a simple question, you will never get a straight answer; he will stare at you and ask you questions back.
lectures are pretty borning but if you memorize the notes you will do great in the class. Get over 90% on final and automatic A+ (always nice).Pretty clear on information, just monotone.
So boring! long exams!
Not bad, material in the course is pretty straightforward so not too hard to do well.  His quiz/midterms are fair (although a bit long) but final was hard!  Lectures = naptime.
crazy hairstyle, fair grader

Dr. Sinclair's notes are very straightforward... they just have to be memorized and you can do great in the course. However, the lectures are very boring and easy to fall asleep in since he is very monotone.
Makes me fall aspleep almost every lecture. :(
No Comments

going to lecture is a major waste of time but the slides are confusing on their own so pick your poison. he doesn't upload the notes ahead of time which would've been fine if he wasn't so hard to follow. half the time you can't hear him and the other half he rambles on and on about things you don't even need to know. just take it with a diff prof

His office hours were amazing (probs why I got an A+). He asks you questions so you can actually understand the material. His lectures are pointless to go to. Read the lectures, go to office hours, and do objective list (practice test not that similar). His tests require you to very much know the material via lectures and the objective list.

Lectures and slide decks are unclear and confusing--he goes off topic a lot during the lecture. Make sure to keep up with the objectives from day 1; they are like a vocabulary list to understand the heavy science jargon in his slides. His class is quite messy and unorganized. Avoid him if possible!!

Dr. Young is a good prof and cares that his students do well. His slides are messy but they contain all the information needed. He is very clear about the testable material and provides lots of practice. At the beginning of every lecture he did open review on the previous lectures content. I recommend taking MBB 222 with him.
Wanted very specific answers for the exam, honestly didn't learn much in lecture. And you will definitely be picked on in lecture.

I really like Dr. Young. I understand some of the ratings because some of the test questions can be confusing(material is hard). BUT he is a great prof, he will sit at office hours with you and really explain things, he also wants you to understand and be capable of explaining things back to him. He's not a “memorize” type of prof.

I honestly really enjoy his class. He provides clear objectives for each week, and only the items on that list are examinable. His exams are fair, he records his lectures, and he is very accessible. The only downside is that the exams can feel a bit rushed, but overall, he is a very good professor. He is passionate and explains things well.

I really liked Dr. Young, he was always there to help outside of class, his lecture material is bit unorganized but if you actually sort through it all of the information is there and its very thorough. His exams are very fair and if you actually go through all the lectures it's all there for you! I would definitely recommend taking it with him!!
takes advantage of students, gets away with it bc he's also a chair associate

RUDE. no care bt you as a student no matter the situation. MESSY slides, inconsistent in marking, only likes his way of teaching, will give you some notes but says they won't be relevant/what you're going to be tested on. 
his response to ANYTHING asked or any type of help/accommodation "see course policies" "contact TA"
Self-teach and stay away

Whenever given the chance, take a class with Dr.Young, it'll really change the way you think and study biology. Dr.Young makes you find the logic and reasoning behind something to understand it rather than simply memorize. This is the most (and best) I've learnt anything bio related, and it has stuck with me. This class despite the stress was fun.

Taking MBB22 with Dr. Young was really interesting and one thing for sure, it changed the way I will ever study biology. He puts more emphasis on insights and the logical reason behind any event, instead of memorizing everything by rote. Another great thing was the writing assignments, it definitely gave me an idea on how to write scientifically.

Dr. Young is very knowledgeable, truly cares for students, and makes an effort to prepare materials for class. But if you decide to take a class with him be prepared to read from the first session. The main problem is that his course note is not suitable for his exams. However, he also posts really helpful archive notes.

Dr.Young isn't a bad prof. ONLY bad thing was he gave 45 min in midterms and for each part on the final (2 parts) instead of 50 min (and 3 hours for final) - there was barely enough time to finish even if you knew every question. If you do the readings, assignments, and go to class, you can do well BUT you have to be fast on exams
He should not be a prof. Have never come across someone as bad as him
His lectures left me more confused about the content and his slides were all over the place. It was easier learning from the slides created by other professors for this course.

the presentations were all over the place. he made the lectures difficult. his class was not enjoyable with all the stress added from 'do it yourself' situation. his tests seemed bit unfair with less time and more question, if you didn't read anything properly, you lost marks. Don't take this class if you want to actually learn.

This class is more work than an organic chemistry class and lab combined.

Every week theres an objective list that requires you to read a sht ton of textbook pages and all sorts of slides and website links to answers the questions on the objective lists and extra exercises given.

Exams were fair if you managed to survive the work.
one of the most horrific classes I've taken

He complicates things when his whole job is supposed to be breaking it down for his students. It's like he wants us to be more confused or something?? I should have listened to the reviews on here, never taking a professor with a low rating again I'm genuinely traumatized.
He is very nice but man you dont have time to think during any of his midterms. Its either you know the answer the first time you read it or you dont.
Just don't
Avoid at all costs.

The professor is nice, but his lectures are not helpful. You have to do a lot of extra reading outside of class time in order to understand what is covered during the lectures. The lecture slides are not helpful either, and consist of way too many things on a single slide in a random order. Avoid taking this class with this professor.

Prof. Young is simultaneously the nicest guy ever and the worst professor. His pdfs and lectures are confusing, and the TA is zero help. Young is so enthusiastic about the material and so likeable (which normally makes the class bearable) but seriously, he is literally the worst professor I have ever had. Take it with another professor if you can.

Excellent professor, provides you with everything you need to succeed: practice, excellent lecture slides, involved iClickers. He even took off some marks from the total of all 3 of the exams. But most importantly he is very knowledgable and very good at explaining things. Wonderful prof, if I could, I would take all of my MBB courses with him.

The lecture notes are very sparse and disorganized, with him often jumping between 4 documents on the overhead. Its better to try to learn lecture material outside of class, but attendance is mandatory due to IClicker. When asked questions during office hours he would just tell us to post the questions on piazza instead of helping in person. 0/5
Great professor. Makes you do the work but the exams are exactly what he requires you to read and learn. No tricks involved. 10/10 would take again.

Dr Young gives you all that you need, straight up. Once you get what you have to do, which is a decent load for a course, then you're set. Follow his instructions on how to study, come to lectures for iClickers, do your readings(provided page by page) and you'll have a breeze with his course! Not your regular approach to teaching but effective.

He's a bit odd. Didn't like him at first, but as the semester progressed, he kinda grew on me. iclickers for participation every class. Slides organized weirdly with the iclickers right smack in the middle of the lecture. Uploads pdf files TO NO END. Txtbook is your friend. The entire course seems randomly organized.

Edgar uses iClickers so it forces you to go to class, but sadly, his lectures are purely useless and he goes off-topic occasionally.  His attitude towards students was quite poor and condescending as well. If I had to learn all the material myself, I wish the course would've been offered online instead.

I'm paraphrasing here, but Dr. Young stated early on that "he's not here to teach us the material, he's here to tell you how to teach yourself".  See, he originally taught MBB 222 online but decided to reuse his learning guides for the in person class so get ready to learn 100% from the textbook. Didn't learn anything in lecture. Had a bad time.

Have to learn everything from the textbook.  Lectures are a waste of time.  He makes "learning objectives" but goes over 10% of material required for the course.  I understand mbb is very difficult, and there is a lot of material, but he wastes time in class being condescending.  I'm a good student, and would recommend avoiding if possible.

In my experience, you really have to work for your grade. This class is basically a self learning course. If you don't like how Dr. Young runs his class, he literally tells you in the beginning of the semester that it's going to be like that every class. Overall, I feel that he is a fair prof as he takes off 15% of your worst quizzes and iclicker.

MBB 222 is itself a very heavy load course meaning the lectures aren't enough time for the prof to go over everything. However Dr. Young's learning guides are all you need, memorize all the vocab and your set. He also offers bonus marks on his exams which help a ton! Would definitely recommend!

Dr. Young did not TEACH us anything! Rather than going through slides about general, important topics, he would focus on minute details of the course content, leaving those who hadn't read ahead lost. Homeworks and iclickers were given on content we had not touched on in class. Midterms were fair, final BRUTAL.

Lecture was completely useless. Spent 80% of class answering student Q's & 1 or 2 Iclicker questions. Be prepared to self-teach yourself ALL the material. Had AMAZING TAs, tutorials super helpful. MT1&2 were reasonable (had 90%+ on MT's) but Final was ridiculous, left 1/3 blank. Prof is condescending & rude to students. Avoid at all costs.
Lectures are useless but you have to come because of iCliker participation marks. TAs and online resources really help.

DO NOT take this class with Professor Young! Minimal material is covered in class, so you have to spend countless hours at home teaching yourself everything that he didn't cover in lecture for every unit. Be ready to do LOTS of reading if you are taking this class with him as there are no lecture slides.

He barely teaches in class so you are expected to learn everything yourself from the textbook. The only reason I ever went to class was because of his iclickers that counted for marks. STAY AWAY from him at ALL COSTS.   He couldn't answer any questions properly and even his TA's were constantly confused as to what he wanted us to know for exams.
he made me lost all the interests about MBB, i was even wondering if i should change my major. since MBB222 is the very first MBB courses to start
Very very bad prof. Try to avoid at all costs
he's the worst prof... never teach anything, just enjoying his own jokes in class and i learned nothing from him, all i have to is to read the books and self-study, useless to go to the lecture.
Very knowledgeable and helpful during office hours. Be prepared to work for your grade.
great prof :D he has a high interest in DNA & RNA..especially DNA!! so i guess he's suited to teach this mbb class since 80% of this class is elaborated on DNA and RNA

he is an awesome prof. don't miss out on the chance to have him as a prof! yeah he talked pretty fast, but if you actually pay attention to what he says, the stuff is easy. a lot of ppl said the final was hard, it sort of was :P but i really enjoyed his class!

super awesome notes, but talks a bit too fast during lecture. I found going to lecture made info stick much easier than having to learn on ur own. approachable. SUPER FAIR MARKING and really, there are no surprises. I don't know what people are complaining about. minimal effort got me a B. If u did poorly, u prolly missed the big picture...

Terrible exam writer-- midterm was ridiculously easy and general, then the final was the other extreme-- obscure details drawn from perhaps 1% of the course content. Controlling prof with little interest in helping students learn and succeed.
No Comments
